quizzes.question_text:
Adam's class wants to give some money to the children's hospital in town. The class is planning to earn the money with a bake sale. So, Adam has baked banana bread to sell. Adam cuts the banana bread into 2 equal pieces.

Which fraction model represents one piece of the banana bread?
quizzes.question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: The banana bread is the whole. Adam cuts it into 2 equal pieces.
The fraction model should have 2 equal parts to match how Adam cut the banana bread.
Color 1 part to show one piece of the banana bread.
This fraction model shows $\frac{1}{2}$ and represents one piece of the banana bread.
solution_image_tag: A rectangle divided into two equal vertical sections. Both sections are outlined in blue but remain unfilled (white interior), representing the whole divided into halves.
The same rectangle divided into two equal vertical sections. The left half is now filled with blue color while the right half remains white, clearly showing one-half shaded.
quizzes.backend_description: A simple rectangle divided into two equal parts. The left half is colored blue, and the right half is white/empty. This represents the fraction 1/2 visually.
image_choice_tags_backend_description: A rectangular bar divided into two sections. The left section is filled with a medium blue color and takes up exactly half of the rectangle. The right section is white/unfilled and also takes up half of the rectangle. The rectangle has a black border outline.

A rectangular bar divided into three equal sections by vertical lines. The leftmost section is filled with a light green color and takes up one-third of the rectangle. The middle and right sections are white/unfilled, each taking up one-third of the rectangle. The rectangle has a black border outline.
